ERROR_NOT_DESKTOP: The administration interface must be run from a desktop computer.
ADMIN_SITE_SETUP_DESCRIPTION: The following values affect basic site behavior.
ADMIN_SITE_SETUP_SITE_NAME_DESCRIPTION: Name of this website as it appears in the website, including in the "Return to [site-name] home" link in the footer
ADMIN_SITE_SETUP_ORGANIZATION_NAME_DESCR: Name of the organization that owns this site.
ADMIN_SITE_SETUP_LOCAL_AREA_CODE_DESCRIP: Area code for local phone numbers. Added to phone numbers that are missing an area code.
ADMIN_SITE_SETUP_AUTODETECT_PHONE_DESCRI: On some web browsers (e.g., iOS), phone numbers are automatically detected and turned into tappable or clickable links. Uncheck this box to disable this behavior site-wide.
ADMIN_SITE_MODULES_DESCRIPTION: Behavior related to the loading of modules
ADMIN_SITE_MODULES_DYNAMIC_NAV_DATA_DESC: When enabled, module's navigation data can be dynamic by using a subclass method. This only has effect if you have subclassed the built in modules. See Developer's Guide for more information. This is an advanced option and should be left off for performance reasons if you do not utilize this feature.
ADMIN_SITE_MODULES_CREATE_DEFAULT_CONFIG: When enabled, if a module is loaded and there is no configuration folder, it will be created with the default. This should normally be off to prevent unnecessary creation of unneeded folders by unused modules.
ADMIN_SITE_SECURITY_REQUIRED_DESCRIPTION: Require a secure (https) connection on all requests. It is also possible to configure secure connections on a per module basis. Note: It is the responsibility of the server administrator to ensure this site can handle secure connections.
ADMIN_SITE_SECURITY_HOST_DESCRIPTION: Alternate host name to use for secure connections. Default is the server hostname
ADMIN_SITE_SECURITY_PORT_DESCRIPTION: Alternate port to use for secure connections. Default is the standard https port (443)
ADMIN_SITE_THEME_DESCRIPTION: Select the visual theme for the site. For more information about creating and modifying themes, see the developer documentation.
ADMIN_SITE_THEME_ACTIVE_DESCRIPTION: Active theme used by this site
ADMIN_SITE_THEME_TABLET_ENABLED_DESCRIPT: If enabled, the Tablet UI will be shown for compatible devices, otherwise tablet devices will use "compliant" page types.
ADMIN_SITE_DETECTION_DESCRIPTION: The device detection service recognizes and categorizes each user's web browser so that the appropriate class of web UI can be delivered. You can run this service on your own web server, or use an externally hosted one such as the reference service provided by Modo Labs.
ADMIN_SITE_DETECTION_VERSION_DESCRIPTION: Version of the Kurogo device detection service
ADMIN_SITE_DETECTION_EXTERNAL_DESCRIPTIO:
Internal: use the included SQLite database for device detection.
External: Use the external version of the Kurogo device detection service hosted by Modo Labs. This introduces a new external dependency for your website but ensures that your system will always be accessing the latest device detection database.
ADMIN_SITE_DETECTION_FILE_DESCRIPTION: Path to the mobi-service device database file within your site
ADMIN_SITE_DETECTION_URL_DESCRIPTION: URL of the externally hosted device-detection service
ADMIN_SITE_DETECTION_CACHE_DESCRIPTION: Time that the device detection service should be cached on the server
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_DESCRIPTION: For optimal runtime performance and security, disable as many types of debugging as possible.
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_DISPLAY_DESCRIPTION: Show error messages generated by PHP scripts
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_DEVICE_DESCRIPTION: Allow overriding device classification using /device/xxx prefix urls
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_MODULE_DESCRIPTION: Show debugging messages generated by modules
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_MINIFY_TITLE: Enable debugging mode for Minify functions
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_MINIFY_DESCRIPTION: Include verbose output in minify CSS and JavaScript data
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_DATA_DESCRIPTION: Verbose logging of data retrieval and database queries
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_DETECTION_TITLE: Enable debugging of device detection services
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_PRODUCTION_HANDLER_DESC: When enabled, the production exception handler will email details of code exceptions to the developer email. If disabled, exceptions will be shown in detail on the screen.
ADMIN_SITE_ERROR_DEVELOPER_EMAIL_DESCRIP: Address to which system-generated error messages should be sent when production exception handler is enabled. If blank, no error-message emails will be generated.
ADMIN_SITE_DATABASE_HOST_DESCRIPTION: Host name of the database server
ADMIN_SITE_DATABASE_USER_DESCRIPTION: User name to access the database server
ADMIN_SITE_DATABASE_PASS_DESCRIPTION: Password to access the database server
ADMIN_SITE_DATABASE_DBNAME_DESCRIPTION: Name of database to store the tables
ADMIN_SITE_COOKIES_DESCRIPTION: Specify how long different types of cookies will be set to persist in each user's browser. By default these cookies are short lived. For production sites, you should increase the time so users' preferences persist longer.
ADMIN_SITE_COOKIES_MODULE_ORDER_DESCRIPT: Cookie used to remember user's preferences for home screen module order.
ADMIN_SITE_COOKIES_LAYOUT_DESCRIPTION: Cookie used to save results of device detection.
ADMIN_SITE_COOKIES_BOOKMARK_DESCRIPTION: Cookie used to save user's bookmarks. Used by modules that have bookmarks
ADMIN_SITE_AUTHENTICATION_ENABLED_DESCRI: Enable user logins and authentication. Required to protect modules
ADMIN_SITE_AUTHENTICATION_WARNING_DESCRI: If you do not use authentication in your site than you should disable the administration module to prevent unauthorized changes.
ADMIN_SITE_AUTHENTICATION_IDLE_DESCRIPTI: Time before idle users are logged off. Set to None to disable idle logoff
ADMIN_SITE_AUTHENTICATION_SESSION_CLASS_: Method used to store data of logged in users. Flat files: data is stored as files in the cache/session folder. Database: session data stored in site database
ADMIN_SITE_AUTHENTICATION_LOGGED_IN_DESC: Time to allow users to be remained logged in, even if closing their browser. Set to none to force users to log in every time.
ADMIN_SITE_ANALYTICS_GOOGLE_DESCRIPTION: If included, pages will be logged to Google Analytics.
ADMIN_SITE_ANALYTICS_PAGE_VIEWS_DESCRIPT: Database table used by the internal statistics engine to log web page views
ADMIN_SITE_ANALYTICS_API_STATS_DESCRIPTI: Database table used by the internal statistics engine to log API requests
ADMIN_SITE_FILES_WEB_LOG_DESCRIPTION: Location of the processed page view log file
ADMIN_SITE_FILES_WEB_CURRENT_LOG_DESCRIP: Location of the active page view log file
ADMIN_SITE_FILES_API_LOG_DESCRIPTION: Location of the processed API log file.
ADMIN_SITE_FILES_API_CURRENT_LOG_DESCRIP: Location of the active API log file
ADMIN_SITE_FILES_DATE_PATTERN_DESCRIPTIO: Regular expression pattern of log dates, should match output from Log Date Format
ADMIN_SITE_FILES_TMP_DIR_DESCRIPTION: Temporary Directory. Will use system default if not specified
ADMIN_SITE_STRINGS_DESCRIPTION: These string values are used throughout the site
ADMIN_SITE_STRINGS_FEEDBACK_EMAIL_DESCRI: Email address where users can send feedback
ADMIN_SITE_MAINTENANCE_DESCRIPTION: Various site maintenance actions and utilities
ADMIN_SITE_MAINTENANCE_CLEAR_CACHES_DESC: Clears the smarty, minify and data caches for the site.
ADMIN_MODULES_OVERVIEW_DESCRIPTION: Use this section to view and manage the overall properties of each module.
ADMIN_MODULES_OVERVIEW_ID_DESCRIPTION: The unique internal module ID. This can only be changed in the source code.
ADMIN_MODULES_OVERVIEW_ENABLED_DESCRIPTI: Module is active for this site.
ADMIN_MODULES_OVERVIEW_HOME_DESCRIPTION: Module is featured on the home screen.
ADMIN_MODULES_OVERVIEW_FEDSEARCH_DESCRIP: Module's contents are included in site-wide federated search.
ADMIN_MODULES_HOMESCREEN_DESCRIPTION: Use this section to manage the modules that appear on the home screen. Primary modules appear larger and can be hidden by users using the Customize module. Secondary modules appear smaller and cannot be removed or rearranged by users. You can also update the label of each module as it appears on the home screen. To remove a module, drag it to the unused modules section.
